titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: A dull, raw morning, with something more than attempts to rain. There were but 22 comts at 8 a.m. when I celebrated. Of these but 6 were males, including two clergy and the clerk.
The congregation was not large, but (in the badness of the weather, and the adjournment of the House) larger than I expected. I preached on 'The Discipline of Moral Failure'.
At Evensong there was a large congregation. I preached on 'Christ's New Commandment', bringing thus to an end the course of sermons on the 'Decalogue'.
